channel.title: Projects on PR
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on PR

item.title: Script to delete xcode buildconfigurations
item.description: Yes, you do not need this solution, unless you know for sure you have one too many build configs and it is time consuming to delete one by one. And the $ Trillion/Billion company do not find enginneers to assign multiple edits in scheme/buildconfig/simulator list in xcode UI.

item.title: Whatchanged - Git history as HTML Report
item.description: Recently I was requested to produce a report of changes in a git repo between two tags by testing team. I am not sure the basis of the request, as they can go through the git repo themselves. I also kind of thought it is better to have a separate report that can be uploaded to their release ticket for archival; instead of going through each commits between revisions or any changes to repo history.

item.title: My Raspberry Pi Collection
item.description: I’ve always been interested in Raspberry Pi. I pre-ordered, waited for about 3+ months and even paid Customs (ridiculous amount) to import my very first Pi.

item.title: TimeTracker
item.description: A native mac app for tracking time to help you manage your productivity. It accepts current task (free text), and keep a timer to log the minutes you spent on task.

item.title: iForce
item.description: Note: I no longer develop Salesforce applications, hence I do not maintain this extension. You are free to fork and maintain.

item.title: Mclock
item.description:
A minimalist clock to display time of different timezone of your choice.

Eg.,

  • “IST” to have a additional clock in your menubar to display Indian Standard Time
  • “EST” for Eastern time
  • Or try “UTC+10”

The app stays in menu bar all the time and you can customize the display format and timezone. Application support native cmd drag to reorder and also works with darkmode
